document_data.name: Temple of Leira
document_data.organizations: Organizations in the Temple of Leira (Bezantur)
document_data.mainbody: The '''Temple of Leira''' was a place of worship dedicated to [[Leira]], the [[goddess]] of lies, located in [[Bezantur]], [[Thay]].
document_data.Location: This small temple was located near the waterfront in southeastern Bezantur, the so-called "City of a Thousand Temples". Appropriately, it was surrounded by other temples, notably the [[Temple of Myrkul (Bezantur)|Temple of Myrkul]] to the west, temples of [[Temple of Tempus (Bezantur)|Tempus]] and [[Temple of Tyr (Bezantur)|Tyr]] to the north, and the [[Temple of Gond (Bezantur)|Temple of Gond]] to the east.
document_data.Activities: The [[priests]] who maintained the temple wore masks to keep their identities anonymous. They were not well-liked in Bezantur because of their reputation for lying constantly. Their hierarchy and leadership—if indeed they had any—was not known by the people.
document_data.History:
Leira was never widely venerated in Thay—with the possible exception of [[illusionists]]—and her temple in Bezantur was not the primary place of her worship in the realm, which was instead centered in [[Eltabbar]]. 

After the disappearance of Leira following the [[Time of Troubles]], the priests of the temple continued to be granted [[spell]]s. As their goddess was assumed to be dead, it was rumored that some other deity was granting these powers.
